intro: Calyptranthes glandulosa, commonly known as the sticky calyptranthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes well-known plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, glandular leaves that produce a sticky substance, which may serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. It produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers, which are typically visited by various pollinators. The plant is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
